papers.title: ${A}_{β}{[E]}_{β}$ in $^{37}\mathrm{K}$ decay: New physics with opposite $β$ helicity
papers.authors: Melissa Anholm, J. A. Behr, D. G. Melconian, G. Gwinner, A. Gorelov, J. C. McNeil, B. Fenker, and S. Behling
papers.summary: Author(s): Melissa Anholm, J. A. Behr, D. G. Melconian, G. Gwinner, A. Gorelov, J. C. McNeil, B. Fenker, and S. BehlingBy extending our analysis and simulations of our $^{37}\mathrm{K}\phantom{\rule{4pt}{0ex}}β$-decay data set to allow the $β$ asymmetry with respect to nuclear spin to vary with $β$ energy ${E}_{β}$, we have gained sensitivity to new physics that depends on a helicity factor for the $β, {m}_{β}/{E}_{…[Phys. Rev. C 113, L012501] Published Fri Jan 02, 2026
